videoTitle: Mindset Behind $50B in Revenue ï½œ Ema Unlimited, Surojit Chatterjee

EMA we built Emma as what we call a

Emma can collaborate with human

today in

uh got a business degree from MIT I was

uh culture where we hire really good

that business from 0 to $50 billion in

many people told me they were impossible

you would think it's the most obvious

wanted to go and experiment in Google
you experiment everything and Google had
this massive experimentation framework
to launch anything you need to get like
significant volume like you need to show
a statistical significance of your

the number of users were really low so
if we just follow the Norms of Google at
that time which is a large desktop
business the mobile features will take
at least 9 months or a year each to

seems like too long and the the mobile

like okay only just a few weeks if

there are many many projects I did this

a little

30er town in India we had to design

Google running a company is different
from popularity contest you cannot
please everyone and whenever if you try
to please everyone as you grow your
company then you will definitely
degenerate your culture the next 3 years
at Google when I ran shopping Google was
becoming a place which was not very
enjoyable to work anymore Google had
actually as a company changed
dramatically from cultural perspective
some of the things that were very
positive about Google had degenerated
into being very negative so Google was a
place where people would always express
their opinion very freely people could
discuss anything but you can can take
that to an extreme and then discuss
anything and everything that is outside
the scope of Google's main mission of
the business and there's everybody is
distracted so I felt actually very
fortunate to leave Google have done
something else have seen something
different at every stage of growth there
is a risk that your culture will
degenerate because you are hiring new
people you have to learn how to work in
a in a different setting and so on so we
have to be very aware and very
deliberate very intentional to maintain
culture in fact you have to take a
stance that this is our culture if you
as an individual don't align with our
culture there are other opportunities
out there other options out there yes
it's possible to maintain the culture
but you have to be ready to be unpopular
make hard calls and be very intentional
about maintaining the
culture look I have run very large teams
grown teams in in companies like Google
coinbase flip cart some of the best
companies in the world and one thing
that always bothered me we had really
talented people but then a large
percentage of their time was still spent
in repetitive work so the idea behind
Emma is can we automate most of the

Enterprises and and free them up to do
more value added more creative tasks in
our journey first thing is we walked
very closely with customers very very
early on we build the product actually
working with multiple customers as
design Partners so from the get go we
knew there is there is a need we knew if
you build it at least there are a few
customers and I think the trick is to
figure out okay are this the only

broader demand so you have to talk to
enough customers to recognize patterns
and make sure okay whatever you are
building is not too custom for this
given customer you may have to do some
custom work for your early customer but
you have to be very clear ey on which
part of your product is a platform that
can be used and which part is maybe you
are customizing a little bit for some of
your early customers the other advice
I'll give to any startup founder or
particularly AI founder focus on
building nothing matters we kept the
company in stealth for a year uh we did
not announce our fundraise we didn't
announce even incorporation so funny
story some of our employees in in India
will complain that what do I tell my
parents where do I work
work it just say Ste and there is no
ifite we kept it under radar uh and Ste
just so we can focus and not get

happening you know there's too much

you of course want to absorb that and
and look at what's happening in the
world but you have to have your own
conviction and you have to block it out
and focus that's so important because
when you build a great product
everything else will fall into place see
our long-term vision is uh will be a
conversational operating system for
every Enterprise out there I think there
